p.name: calc_method
p.detail:
[Optional-defaults to TRUE()] - A logical value that specifies the method used to calculate the total accrued interest when the settlement date is later than the first interest accrual date. 

If the value is TRUE, the total accrued interest from the issue date to the settlement date is returned. 

If the value is FALSE, return the accrued interest from the first interest accrual date to the settlement date.

LINESPLINES.d: Generate sparklines embedded in the cell to describe the continuous trend of data

p.name: Range
p.detail: Range，Values can be calculated effectively, such as A1:A20, {1,2,3,4,5}, etc.

p.name: Line color
p.detail: The line color of the line graph can be range A1, color table index value or specific color value. Set it to 0 or false to not display it. It supports regx, rgb, rgba, etc. Default #2ec7c9

p.name: Line thickness
p.detail: Line thickness of the line graph, the default is 1px

p.name: Auxiliary line
p.detail: A horizontal line, which can be min, max, avg, median, range or custom value, default 0 none

p.name: Auxiliary line color
p.detail: Color setting of auxiliary line, same as line color configuration, default #000

p.name: Maximum mark
p.detail: Identifies the maximum value of the line graph, the same line color configuration, default 0 does not display

p.name: Minimum mark
p.detail: Identify the minimum value of the line graph, the same line color configuration, default 0 does not display

p.name: Mark size
p.detail: The maximum and minimum mark size settings, the default is 1.5

AREASPLINES.d: Generate sparklines embedded in the cell area chart, generally used to describe the continuous cumulative value trend of the data

p.name: Range
p.detail: Range，Values can be calculated effectively, such as A1:A20, {1,2,3,4,5}, etc.

p.name: Line color
p.detail: The line color of the line graph can be range A1, color table index value or specific color value. Set it to 0 or false to not display it. It supports regx, rgb, rgba, etc. Default #2ec7c9

p.name: Fill color
p.detail: Form an area chart, the same line color configuration, default 0 does not display

p.name: Line thickness
p.detail: Line thickness of the line graph, the default is 1px

p.name: Auxiliary line
p.detail: A horizontal line, which can be min, max, avg, median, range or custom value, default 0 none

p.name: Auxiliary line color
p.detail: Color setting of auxiliary line, same as line color configuration, default #000

COLUMNSPLINES.d: Generate sparklines embedded in the vertical histogram of cells, generally used to describe the size of discrete data

p.name: Range
p.detail: Range，Values can be calculated effectively, such as A1:A20, {1,2,3,4,5}, etc.

p.name: Bar interval
p.detail: The distance between bars, the default is 1

p.name: Bar color
p.detail: The line color of the line graph can be range A1, color table index value or specific color value. Set it to 0 or false to not display it. It supports regx, rgb, rgba, etc. Default #fc5c5c

p.name: Negative bar color
p.detail: Negative bar color setting, representing the color of negative value, same as the bar color configuration, default #97b552

p.name: Max
p.detail: The maximum value of the bar chart, used to standardize the length of the bar chart, the default is to automatically calculate false, auto, null

p.name: Color palette
p.detail: The color palette can set the color of each bar individually, multiple settings can be set, and two formats are supported: 1 color such as #000, which means that the color of the first bar is black; 2 value range: color, such as -2:# 000 indicates that the bar with a value of -2 is black, 0:5:#000 indicates that the bar with a value of 0-5 is black, and the default is empty

STACKCOLUMNSPLINES.d: Generate sparklines, a cumulative vertical histogram embedded in a cell, generally used to describe the numerical size of multiple dimensions of discrete data

p.name: Range
p.detail: Range，Values can be calculated effectively, such as A1:A20, {1,2,3,4,5}, etc.

p.name: Stack by column
p.detail: If you need to stack by row, set this item to false or 0, the default is 1

p.name: Bar interval
p.detail: The distance between bars, the default is 1

p.name: Max
p.detail: The maximum value of the cumulative bar, used to regulate the length of the bar, the default is to automatically calculate false, auto, null

p.name: Color palette
p.detail: The color palette can individually set the bar color of each dimension, which can be set to the range of A1:A10, etc. The default is #2ec7c9, #fc5c5c, #5ab1ef, #ffb980...

SORT.d: Sorts the rows of a given array or range by the values in one or more columns.
SORT.a: Sorts rows of range by specified column.

p.name: range
p.detail: The data to be sorted.

p.name: sort_column
p.detail: The index of the column in `range` or a range outside of `range` containing the values by which to sort.

p.name: is_ascending
p.detail: `TRUE` or `FALSE` indicating whether to sort `sort_column` in ascending order. `FALSE` sorts in descending order.

p.name: sort_column2
p.detail: Additional columns.

FILTER.d: Returns a filtered version of the source range, returning only rows or columns which meet the specified conditions.
FILTER.a: Filters a range based off provided conditions.

p.name: range
p.detail: The data to be filtered.

p.name: condition1
p.detail: A column or row containing true or false values corresponding to the first column or row of `range`, or an array formula evaluating to true or false.

p.name: condition2
p.detail: Additional rows or columns containing boolean values `TRUE` or `FALSE` indicating whether the corresponding row or column in `range` should pass through `FILTER`. Can also contain array formula expressions which evaluate to such rows or columns. All conditions must be of the same type (row or column). Mixing row conditions and column conditions is not permitted.

UNIQUE.d: Returns unique rows in the provided source range, discarding duplicates. Rows are returned in the order in which they first appear in the source range.
UNIQUE.a: Unique rows in the provided source range.

p.name: range
p.detail: The data to filter by unique entries.

p.name: by_col
p.detail: [Option] - Logical value, indicating how to compare; by row = FALSE() or omitted; by column = TRUE().

p.name: occurs_once
p.detail: [Option] - Logical value, only one occurrence in the unique value is returned = TRUE(); including all unique values = FALSE() or omitted.

RANDARRAY.d: Returns a grid of random numbers between 0 inclusive and 1 exclusive. The grid size will match the provided rows and columns arguments. If neither rows nor columns are provided, then the grid will be size 1 x 1.
RANDARRAY.a: Returns a grid of random numbers.

p.name: rows
p.detail: The number of rows to populate with a random number.

p.name: columns
p.detail: The number of columns to populate with a random number.

SEQUENCE.d: Returns a grid of sequential numbers starting at a specified start value and  increasing by a specified step size. By default, the sequence starts at and  increases by 1.
SEQUENCE.a: Returns a grid of sequential numbers.

p.name: rows
p.detail: The number of rows in the function's resulting grid.

p.name: columns
p.detail: The number of columns in the function's resulting grid. If omitted, the result grid will have 1 column.

p.name: start
p.detail: The number, at which to start the sequence. If omitted, the sequence will start at 1.

p.name: step
p.detail: The amount each value in the sequence will differ by. If omitted, each value will differ by 1.

EVALUATE.d: Evaluate a formula or expression expressed in words and return the result
EVALUATE.a: Evaluate according to literal formula or expression.

p.name: expression
p.detail: Formula or expression

REMOTE.d: Calls a function on a remote server
REMOTE.a: Calls a function on a remote back end server/API.

p.name: remote_expression
p.detail: Formula
